title.narrative: F.a: Strengthening Dues Management of ASPEK

description.narrative: The project aims at developing the Indonesian service sector trade union ASPEK into a strong and financially sustainable organisation that can effectively promote the interests of its members and participate successfully in the improvement of workers' righ ts at the national level.The problems of Indonesia's services sector, as those of the country?s working life as a whole, are poorly realised fundamental rights of workers, employers' hostility towards trade unions, fragmented trade union movement and the internal weakness of trade unions. Independent and democratic trade unions have been able to operate freely in Indonesia only after 1998. The biggest internal challenges for ASPEK are an underdeveloped system of dues collection and lack of income from memb ership fees. In particular, employers are opposed to the check-off system for unions because it would rapidly improve the trade unions? economic potential and boost their effectiveness on interest representation.During the project ASPEK?s financial indepen dence and dues collection systems will be strengthened by adding the check-off system, increasing the number of paying members and the ASPEK membership fee. In addition, the project also seeks to push through percentage-based membership fee system.Benefici aries of the project are trade union ASPEK?s rank and file members and more broadly the unorganised labour in the service sector in Indonesia, whose interest representation is challenging and whose fundamental rights are poorly realised.The project is imp lemented by private international services sector global union federation UNI Global Union together with Indonesian trade union ASPEK.
